This surely contains a list of codes, but does not provide any description 
as to what the code is supposed to do. Except for maybe test mode or 
engineer mode, all other codes have no description. First time users who 
wish to *see* what a particular code would do, will end up executing it 
without proper confirmation or consequences. Is the the developer that dumb 
to not think this through?
I love this app that actually does what it advertises

Works with every phone I tested (Nokia 6 7.1.2, S4 mini Resurrection remix 7.1.2 and note 3 4.4.2) without root. NOTE: people who put a 1 star review saying your phone is broken, YOU are the one who fiddled with the secret menus, the app just directs you to the secret menu so don't blame the app because it's your responsibility for playing with the settings in the menus.

google_play_reviews.replyContent: The codes are only the ones effectively on your device. This app is crawling others apps to find these kind of codes, so No, they are all codes from your device. But they can sometimes do nothing, or more precisely, they do something in the background.
